content:
Exactly! You've got it. Since x ∈ W, and W is an open set contained in (A∪B)^c, x belongs to the interior of (A∪B)^c, which is the exterior of A∪B by definition. Thus, x ∈ (A∪B)^e.

So, we've shown that A^e ∩ B^e ⊆ (A∪B)^e. Combining this with our earlier result that (A∪B)^e ⊆ A^e ∩ B^e, we can conclude that (A∪B)^e = A^e ∩ B^e.

Great job working through this proof! If you have any more questions or need help with other topics, feel free to ask.
